intro: Tridactyle aurantiopunctata, commonly known as the golden-spotted tridactyle, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of orange and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
